explanation_composer.regulatory_rule_cue:
SOLAS Chapter V / IMO Guidelines for Ship Reporting Systems – Applicable in designated shipping lanes and near critical subsea infrastructure (e.g., Nord Stream pipelines, C-Lion 1 cable) in the Baltic Sea – Spatial Anchor: Proximity to regulated maritime corridors between Travemünde (Germany) and Liepāja (Latvia)
Operational Protocol Rationale: Passenger vessels of this size and configuration typically follow straight, predefined routes when transiting busy or sensitive areas, especially near major shipping lanes and subsea infrastructure zones. The observed stable speed, consistent course over ground, and tight alignment between heading and motion direction indicate disciplined autopilot-assisted navigation along a fixed corridor. This behavior is characteristic of scheduled ferry operations that prioritize predictable, safe passage through high-traffic or environmentally sensitive regions. Alternative behaviors such as anchoring, maneuvering, or deviating from the route are unlikely given the continuous engine use, absence of hazardous cargo, and lack of course fluctuations. The linear trajectory interpolation is therefore justified as it reflects standard operating procedures for passenger vessels in these regulated waters.
'''
